How to use this package

Source: vignettes/usage.Rmd
usage.Rmd

Exported functions

analyse()

The parse tree is analysed. Each node of the tree is given the following attributes:

  • type
  • mode
  • class
  • length
  • text
  • is
  • n_modes
  • n_classes
  • path
  • fulltype
  • children

The idea probably was to use these information to extract objects of special interest from the parse tree (see below: get_elements_by_type())

url_log <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KWB-R/kwb.utils/master/R/log.R"
url_main <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/KWB-R/kwb.utils/master/R/main.R"

x <- parse(url_log)

result <- kwb.code::analyse(x)
#> Error in as.POSIXct.default(x) :

arg_names()

This function returns the names of the arguments of a function:

kwb.code::arg_names(kwb.utils::selectColumns)
#> [1] "x"       "columns" "pattern" "drop"    "do.stop"

find_string_constants()

This function requires a directory of R scripts. All scripts are parsed. String constants that are used in the script are returned.

# Provide scripts in a folder
root <- kwb.utils::createDirectory(kwb.utils::tempSubdirectory("test"))
#> The directory "/var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpMwRtoK/test" already exists.

url <- url_main
download.file(url, destfile = file.path(root, basename(url)), mode = "wt")

string_constants <- kwb.code::find_string_constants(root)
#> Splitting paths ... ok. (0.00 secs) 
#> Removing the first 8 path segments ... ok. (0.00 secs) 
#> Reading /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpMwRtoK/test/main.R ... ok. (0.00 secs)

knitr::kable(string_constants)
file_id folder_path file_name string count
file_01 test main.R 2
file_01 test main.R *** The object is empty! 1
file_01 test main.R as requested but 1
file_01 test main.R _()$ 1
file_01 test main.R ! 1
file_01 test main.R . 1
file_01 test main.R ‘assign(x, value, envir = .GlobalEnv)’ 1
file_01 test main.R (returned in attribute ‘invalid’) 1
file_01 test main.R %s_%d 1
file_01 test main.R %s_1 1
file_01 test main.R $ 1
file_01 test main.R assignGlobally() 1
file_01 test main.R Bug in randomValuesWithSum(): The sum of generated values is not 1
file_01 test main.R Division by zero. Using substitute value of 1
file_01 test main.R invalid 1
file_01 test main.R parName 1
file_01 test main.R parVal 1
file_01 test main.R stringsAsFactors 1
file_01 test main.R stringsAsFactors must be TRUE or FALSE 1
file_01 test main.R The first element must not be NA 1
file_01 test main.R There are differences in parallel non-NA values 1
file_01 test main.R There are duplicate values: 1

find_weaknesses_in_scripts()

Check for expressions in scripts that can be improved.

x <- parse(text = c(
  "texts <- c(", 
  "  paste('this is a very long', 'text'),",
  "  paste('this is a very long', 'string')",
  ")",
  "",
  "indices <- 1:length(texts)"
))

weaknesses <- kwb.code::find_weaknesses_in_scripts(
  x = list(test = x), 
  min_duplicate_frequency = 2L
)

knitr::kable(weaknesses)
file expression frequency recommendation
1 test 1:length(texts) 1 use seq_along()
3 test “this is a very long” 2 check for duplicated strings

get_elements_by_type

This function groups similar elements that are found in a parse tree.

# Parse an R script file (here, a file from kwb.utils)
x <- parse(url_log)

# For each "type" of code segment, extract all occurrences
elements <- kwb.code::get_elements_by_type(x, result = result)

# Show all code blocks in curly braces
elements[["language|call|{|2|"]]
#> [[1]]
#> {
#>     cat("***", ...)
#> }
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> {
#>     cat("***", ..., "\n")
#> }
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> {
#>     catIf(dbg, "*** ok.\n")
#> }
#> 
#> [[4]]
#> {
#>     catIf(dbg, "***", ..., "... ")
#> }

get_full_function_info()

This function analyses a list of parse trees each of which has been read from an R script.

It provides information on the functions that are defined in the scripts:

  • script: script name
  • functionName: function name
  • n.def: always 1 (?)
  • bodyClass: always “{” (?)
  • n.args: number of arguments
  • n.defaults: number of arguments with a default
  • n.expr: number of expressions
kwb.code::get_full_function_info(trees = kwb.code::parse_scripts(root))
#> Reading /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpMwRtoK/test/main.R ... ok. (0.00 secs)
#>    script             functionName n.def bodyClass n.args n.defaults n.expr
#> 1  main.R                assignAll     1         {      3          1      2
#> 2  main.R           assignGlobally     1         {      2          0      2
#> 3  main.R     assignPackageObjects     1         {      1          0      1
#> 4  main.R          breakInSequence     1         {      2          1      2
#> 5  main.R callWithStringsAsFactors     1         {      3          0      6
#> 6  main.R             extendLimits     1         {      4          2      3
#> 7  main.R           getEvenNumbers     1         {      1          0      1
#> 8  main.R              getGlobally     1         {      3          2      2
#> 9  main.R            getOddNumbers     1         {      1          0      1
#> 10 main.R       hsMatrixToListForm     1         {      6          4      4
#> 11 main.R               hsSafeName     1         {      2          0      3
#> 12 main.R               makeUnique     1         {      4          3      3
#> 13 main.R            naToLastNonNa     1         {      2          1      6
#> 14 main.R            parallelNonNA     1         {      2          0     12
#> 15 main.R                 quotient     1         {      4          2      6
#> 16 main.R      randomValuesWithSum     1         {      3          1      5
#> 17 main.R           recursiveNames     1         {      2          1      4
#> 18 main.R              warnIfEmpty     1         {      1          0      2

get_names_of_used_packages()

What packages are used in the scripts?

kwb.code::get_names_of_used_packages(root)
#> Analysing /var/folders/24/8k48jl6d249_n_qfxwsl6xvm0000gn/T//RtmpMwRtoK/test/main.R ... ok. (0.00 secs)
#> character(0)
